title: How many pages does a book have to have to be considered a book? - Quora

response.answer_text: There is actually no definition of books when it comes to pages. We can define fictions or non-fictions based on how many lines are there. A binding can’t be a book if i just has some pages.(e.g a diary).A diary has pages and you can write on it but it still can’t be considered a book if it doesn’t contain anything specific . There are children’s books based on just so. Now a days we have electronic books,pdf. We don’t have the criteria what is book or what is just a document. To conclude,it is not easy to define books on some simple criteria.

According to the terms defined as part of ONIX, the book trade’s metadata standard, the term is very broad. See the code list here ONIX codelists Issue 40 If it has pages (made of paper, foam, rag, cardboard, etc.) with a form of binding (glue, slide, stapled, etc), then that’s a book. It’s possibly easier to say what isn’t a book – a pamphlet, a map … You can also optionally include electronic books in there. Some stationery products are difficult to classify though (e.g. a diary).
